intro: Alcantarea vasconcelosiana, commonly known as the "Cape Verdean tree fern," is a striking plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant has a unique appearance with a fern-like crown that can reach up to 10 meters in height. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in tropical ecosystems.
